pageProps.title: How to Build Real-time Applications with Node.js and MongoDB Change Streams
pageProps.metaDesc: Node.js and MongoDB are two popular technologies used for building real-time applications. While Node.js is a server-side JavaScript runtime environment, MongoDB is a NoSQL document-oriented database. MongoDB Change Streams is a feature that enables real-time data processing and notifications for MongoDB collections. In this tutorial, we will explore how to build real-time applications with Node.js and MongoDB Change Streams.
